definition: to withdraw (oneself) from residence in or allegiance to one's native country
to leave one's native country to live elsewhere, to renounce allegiance to one's native country
a person who lives in a foreign country
examples: Hemingway himself in The Sun Also Rises, 1926, had given the picture of the dislocated life of young English and American expatriates in the bars of Paris, the "lost generation," as Gertrude Stein defined them.
